snippet: Tests showed the presence of a partially degraded form of distilled sulfur mustard, a banned substance that burns a victims’ skin, air pathways and eyes.
abstract: American military officials confirm that ordnance used by Islamic State militants in multiple artillery attacks against civilians in Syria and Iraq contained chemical warfare agents, including sulfur mustard and chlorine.

byline.original: By C. J. CHIVERS and ERIC SCHMITT

lead_paragraph: Tests showed the presence of a partially degraded form of distilled sulfur mustard, a banned substance that burns a victims’ skin, air pathways and eyes.

headline.main: Islamic State Ordnance Shows Traces of Chemical Agents, U.S. Says
headline.print_headline: Islamic State Ordnance Shows Traces of Chemical Agents, U.S. Says

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
